message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is experiencing symptoms of PTSD, and nightmares are a common symptom. Prazosin, an alpha-blocker, has been shown to be effective in reducing the frequency and intensity of nightmares in patients with PTSD. Diazepam and Triazolam are benzodiazepines and should be used with caution in patients with PTSD. Phenelzine is an MAOI antidepressant and not a first-line treatment for PTSD.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest that the patient is suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). Prazosin is a medication that has been shown to be useful in reducing nightmares and improving sleep in patients with PTSD. Diazepam and Triazolam are benzodiazepines that can be used for insomnia but are not first-line treatment for PTSD. Phenelzine is a monoamine oxidase inhibitor that can be used for depression but is not first-line treatment for PTSD.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), including vivid dreams and avoidance behaviors. Sertraline, an antidepressant, was started but did not improve symptoms. Prazosin, an alpha-blocker, has been shown to improve sleep disturbance and nightmares associated with PTSD. Diazepam and triazolam are benzodiazepines and are not recommended for long-term use due to potential for dependence and abuse. Phenelzine is a monoamine oxidase inhibitor used for depression and anxiety disorders, but is not specifically indicated for PTSD.
